channel.title: [Tutorial] Rewriting your URL to always include "www" for SEO
channel.description:
[url=https://www.jamesmonger.com/post/rewriting-your-url-to-always-include-www.html]Rewriting your URL to always include "www"[/url]
A very quick and easy guide on how to make a good improvement to your search engine ranking :)

item.title: [Tutorial] Rewriting your URL to always include "www" for SEO
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Ruby:

Plus this section is fudgeing dead so its good to have a breath of fresh air now and again

So true.

Read full topic
item.source: [Tutorial] Rewriting your URL to always include "www" for SEO

item.title: [Tutorial] Rewriting your URL to always include "www" for SEO
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:6, topic:547177”]Anyone who knows anything about SEO knows it’s a pain in the arse so something as simple as this isn’t to be sniffed at just because the larger search engines don’t take it into account

Plus this section is fudgeing dead so its good to have a breath of fresh air now and again[/quote]

It can also solve some cookie bugs, I’ve found. Before, cookies would be stored differently for www.mysite.com and mysite.com.

Read full topic

Anyone who knows anything about SEO knows it’s a pain in the arse so something as simple as this isn’t to be sniffed at just because the larger search engines don’t take it into account

item.title: [Tutorial] Rewriting your URL to always include "www" for SEO
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:4, topic:547177”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=666081.msg4453033#msg4453033 date=1412859860]
Given you’re using Apache and have mod_rewrite.

Is this actually good for SEO?
[/quote]
Not for Google. Google don’t care about this shit! The OP probably uses babylon.

Edit: I was too slow at replying :([/quote]

Yeah, Google, Bing etc all don’t care but there are people in the world who still use Ask Jeeves

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Rewriting your URL to always include "www" for SEO
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:2, topic:547177”]Given you’re using Apache and have mod_rewrite.

Is this actually good for SEO?[/quote]

Yeah it is good for SEO, search engines (admittedly not Google or Bing, but some smaller ones) can see www.mysite.com and mysite.com as different sites so the rankings are half what they should be

Read full topic
